Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.localGame

Class LocalClientHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.ClientHandler
it.polimi.ingsw.network.localGame.LocalClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
NetworkUser<ResponseToClient,​Command>
public class LocalClientHandler
extends ClientHandler
this class represent the local client handler. in particular, this class extends the ClientHandler class because it is used only in case of local match. it redefine some methods to simulate the network exchange of message as some methods call, as the send, the createGame, the sendInBroadcast, the readMessage, ecc..

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    LocalClientHandler​(View view)
    this constructor create the local client handler starting from the reference of the client to interact with calling method that simulates the network message exchange

    this method get the list of Client Handlers associated with every client that joined the lobby.

    this method get the game associated with the lobby joined from the client.

    this method get a list of String representing the nicknames of every player that joined the lobby.

    this method get the number of players of the lobby joined by the client.

    this method get the socket associated with the client.

    this method indicates if if the turn of the client or not.

    this method is used only by the subclass localClientHandler.

    this method send a message to the client associated.

    this method notify every player of the disconnection of the game for any possible reason, and close the connection.
    void sendInBroadcast​(ResponseToClient message)
    this method send in broadcast the message in input, it simulate the method notify for the pattern notify-observer.

  • Method Details

    • readMessage

      public boolean readMessage​(Command command)
      this method is used only by the subclass localClientHandler. it is used to read the message starting from the command passed in input, and then will be called the method processCommand on it
      Overrides:
      readMessage in class ClientHandler
      Parameters:
      command - this is the command to process
      See Also:
      LocalClientHandler

    • send

      public void send​(ResponseToClient message)
      this method send a message to the client associated. in particular, in this class simply calls the method updateClient(view) in order to change his state
      Specified by:
      send in interface NetworkUser<ResponseToClient,​Command>
      Overrides:
      send in class ClientHandler
      Parameters:
      message - this is the message to send
      See Also:
      ResponseToClient

    • sendBroadcastDisconnection

      public void sendBroadcastDisconnection()
      this method notify every player of the disconnection of the game for any possible reason, and close the connection. in this subclass just call the method send with an error message to the client
      Overrides:
      sendBroadcastDisconnection in class ClientHandler

    • sendInBroadcast

      public void sendInBroadcast​(ResponseToClient message)
      this method send in broadcast the message in input, it simulate the method notify for the pattern notify-observer. in this subclass just use the method send redefined in this class with the message in input
      Overrides:
      sendInBroadcast in class ClientHandler
      Parameters:
      message - this is the message to send in broadcast

    • getNicknames

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getNicknames()
      this method get a list of String representing the nicknames of every player that joined the lobby. in this class, it create a singleton list containing the nickname of the local client
      Overrides:
      getNicknames in class ClientHandler
      Returns:
      the nicknames of every player that joined the lobby

    • addNickname

      public void addNickname​(java.lang.String nickname)
      this method add a nickname to the list of nicknames associated with the lobby. in this subclass, the method do nothing
      Overrides:
      addNickname in class ClientHandler
      Parameters:
      nickname - this is the nickname to add

    • getGame

      public Game getGame()
      this method get the game associated with the lobby joined from the client. in this subclass, get the reference of the single game stored as attribute of the subclass
      Overrides:
      getGame in class ClientHandler
      Returns:
      the game associated with the lobby joined from the client

    • createGame

      public void createGame()
      this method create the game to play for the lobby joined by the client. in particular, this method if the lobby is composed only by one player, will create a single game, a normal one otherwise. in this subclass create a single game with the unique nickname of the local client
      Overrides:
      createGame in class ClientHandler

    • getClients

      public java.util.List<ClientHandler> getClients()
      this method get the list of Client Handlers associated with every client that joined the lobby. it is mainly used to send broadcast messages. in this subclass this method return a singleton list with this object
      Overrides:
      getClients in class ClientHandler
      Returns:
      the list of client handlers associated with every client that joined the lobby

    • getNumberOfPlayers

      public int getNumberOfPlayers()
      this method get the number of players of the lobby joined by the client. in particular, when a client want to start a game, and selecting the number of players desired, if there isn't space in any lobby, the waiting room creates one and store there the number of player, that this method get. in this subclass, it simply return 1
      Overrides:
      getNumberOfPlayers in class ClientHandler
      Returns:
      the number of players of the lobby joined by the client

    • isYourTurn

      public boolean isYourTurn()
      this method indicates if if the turn of the client or not. if the match is composed only by one player, it should return true always. in this subclass, it always return true
      Overrides:
      isYourTurn in class ClientHandler
      Returns:
      true if id the turn of the client, false otherwise

    • getSocket

      public java.net.Socket getSocket()
      this method get the socket associated with the client. in this subclass, the method returns null
      Overrides:
      getSocket in class ClientHandler
      Returns:
      the socket associated with the client
